paws 0.1.9

Updates an input

Source: R/medialive_operations.R
medialive_update_input.Rd

Updates an input.

medialive_update_input(Destinations, InputDevices, InputId,
  InputSecurityGroups, MediaConnectFlows, Name, RoleArn, Sources)

Arguments

Destinations

Destination settings for PUSH type inputs.
InputDevices

Settings for the devices.
InputId

[required] Unique ID of the input.
InputSecurityGroups

A list of security groups referenced by IDs to attach to the input.
MediaConnectFlows

A list of the MediaConnect Flow ARNs that you want to use as the source of the input. You can specify as few as one Flow and presently, as many as two. The only requirement is when you have more than one is that each Flow is in a separate Availability Zone as this ensures your EML input is redundant to AZ issues.
Name

Name of the input.
RoleArn

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role this input assumes during and after creation.
Sources

The source URLs for a PULL-type input. Every PULL type input needs exactly two source URLs for redundancy. Only specify sources for PULL type Inputs. Leave Destinations empty.

Request syntax

svc$update_input(
  Destinations = list(
    list(
      StreamName = "string"
    )
  ),
  InputDevices = list(
    list(
      Id = "string"
    )
  ),
  InputId = "string",
  InputSecurityGroups = list(
    "string"
  ),
  MediaConnectFlows = list(
    list(
      FlowArn = "string"
    )
  ),
  Name = "string",
  RoleArn = "string",
  Sources = list(
    list(
      PasswordParam = "string",
      Url = "string",
      Username = "string"
    )
  )
)
